summary: This bill, the Edward J. Dwight, Jr. Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2025, proposes awarding a Congressional Gold Medal to Edward J. Dwight, Jr., the first African American astronaut candidate. It recognizes his historic service, his example of excellence in the face of racism, and his contributions to art and Black history. The bill authorizes the striking of a gold medal with Dwight's image and name, along with the creation and sale of bronze duplicates. It also specifies the funding source and considers the medals as numismatic items.
